columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked answer the questions by applying the concept of spot rate and forward rate.

## a.

We are asked to determine if the yen is expected to get stronger or weaker.

The spot and three-month forward rates for the yen are ¥113.65 and ¥113.18, respectively. Since the spot rate is greater than the forward rate, the yen is **expected to get stronger**.  Lesser yens are required to buy a dollar after 3 months.

## b.

We are asked to determine the difference between the annual inflation rates of the United States and Japan.

A **purchasing power parity** refers to the thought that the exchange rate adjusts in order to keep a *constant purchasing power* among the currencies. There are **two forms** of PPP, the *absolute* PPP and *relative* PPP.
A **relative purchasing power parity** refers to the concept that there is a *change in exchange rate* that can be determined by the *difference of the inflation rate* of two countries.

The formula to determine the exchange rate based on the relative purchasing power parity is as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{$E(S_{3})$} &=\text{$S_{0}$}\times[ 1+\text{($h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$)}]^t\\\
\end{aligned}$$

wherein: 

$E(S_{t})$ = Expected exchange rate in *t* periods 

$S_{0}$ = Current spot exchange rate  

$h_{FC}$ = Foreign country inflation rate 

$h_{US}$ = Inflation rate in the US

We are given the following data:

<center>

| |Japanese Yen | 
|--|--| 
|Spot Rate| ¥113.65| 
|Three-month forward rates|¥ 113.18|

We will apply the formula of relative purchasing power parity to determine the difference in the inflation rates for the United States and Poland. The computation is as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{$E(S_{3/12})$} &=\text{$S_{0}$}\times[ 1+\text{($h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$)}]^t\\[10pt]
\text{¥ 113.18}&=\text{¥113.65}\times[ 1+\text{($h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$)}]^{3/12}\\[10pt]
\dfrac{\text{¥ 113.18}}{\text{{¥ 113.65}}}&=1+\text{($h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$)}^{1/4}\\[10pt]
{\text{¥ 0.9959}}^{4}&=1+\text{($h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$)}\\[10pt]
\text{$h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$} &=0.9837-1\\[10pt]
\text{$h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$} &=\boxed{\text{- 0.0163 or 1.63\%}}
\end{aligned}$$
The difference in inflation rate is **-1.63%**. This indicates the the inflation rate in the United States is greater than the inflation rate in Japan by 1.63%.
